entries.description: The center & home-base of Further Confusion operations. Come here to get information, check lost-and-found, and check in if you're a presenter or panelist. If you're looking to help out, sign up here as a gofur!

entries.description: If you're a dealer, your dealer assistants and you may come into the Dealers Den to load in and set up.

entries.description: Come pick up your attendee badge early if you've already registered ahead of time!

entries.name: Registration
entries.description: Come to registration to get your attendee badge! We look forward to welcoming you to the con.

entries.name: Art Show: Artist Setup
entries.description: The Art Show is open for artists to hang their pieces. The room is not open to general attendees.

entries.name: ANE Portal
entries.description: The mascot of Anthro New England, Copley, has gone missing!  Can you help our friends from Boston find the deer and solve the mystery?

entries.name: Advanced Worldbuilding - Science and Culture
entries.description: A panel for creators who are interested in taking their story and worldbuilding schedules beyond the usual tropes seen in a large body of furry writing.  What should a writer worry about when describing advanced technology or magic?  What about maps?  In addition to some useful software that can help flesh out the story, a list of considerations for building cultures will also be discussed.

entries.name: VR Portal
entries.description: See your friends in VR! Located in the Santa Clara foyer of the Hilton.

entries.name: Krita: Open Source Digital Painting
entries.description: Krita is a free and open source digital painting application. This panel will explore Krita's interface and features with topics like layer types, brush engines and settings, vector shapes, and drawing assistants. We'll also discuss useful customizations, workflow tips, and resources.

entries.name: Fursuit Lounge
entries.description: Need a place to cool off? Come on in and hang up your head! We have water and fans available for you, so you can fursuit safely.

entries.name: Chill Space
entries.description: Open chill area to rest, hang out, or hold games.

location.name: Marriott: Marriott Stage (Salon I to VI)

entries.name: The Banana Chronicles: How Appealing
entries.description: Listen to hilarious stories told by a business casual banana.

entries.name: Be Deer, Frolic Safe!
entries.description: A brief overview of harm reduction practices and how furries of all kinds can help their community! Promoting safety, dignity, and education in our fandom.

entries.name: Opening Ceremonies
entries.description:
Join us in kicking off Further Confusion 2025: Animal Business

Our chair, Woofy, and other members of the team will welcome you to San Jose for a weekend of fur and fun.

entries.name: The Joy of Rope
entries.description: Whether you are experienced with shibari or curious about rope, we will show you how to incorporate it into your fursuit expression, private play, or even just as meditative form of self care.

There's something here for everyone! Either to waste time between events or as a place to chill, we will be here. Bags will be checked at the door. Learn more: http://furcon.org/programming/gaming/

entries.name: Twisted Tails Escape
entries.description:
Yarrrrrrr! Reckon ye’ve got what it takes to discover the Secret of the Furbidden Treasure? Or perhaps you want to help Captain Cody Escape from Otter Space! 

Tickets are $25 per person with a maximum of 10 players per group. Players by themselves or in a small group will be paired up with other like-minded adventurers to a maximum of 10 players per game. For private bookings, a minimum of 5 tickets must be purchased. Also, a portion of every ticket will go to the convention's charity! If you have any questions, please contact us directly at info@twistedtailsescape.com.

entries.description: Cons are a magical place where people l can let loose and have fun. Make the magic last all year long with this hybrid style panel to teach you how to make friends, and a meet and greet to get started right away!

entries.description: Meet up with fellow pilots and other aviation workers and enthusiasts. Includes a panel portion and a meet & greet portion.

entries.description: Use the ancient Chinese puzzle to make the convention’s mascots, Almaden the dragon, Berkeley the dog, and Clara the cat.  First 40 will get a kit with one pre-cut tangram and two paper squares for DIY.

Then come and join host Jerry Opossum and Skipper the Kit Fox to learn how to make your home fire-safe! Remember, having fire safety in mind now can save a life in the future, so don't delay and join in!

entries.description: It's time to audition for the Fursuit Dance Comp! Note, this is a closed event; please sign up on the FC website beforehand if you want to audition.

location.name: Marriott: Marriott Stage (Salon I to VI)

entries.name: HELP WITH SHYNESS
entries.description: Shyness is the emotional fear that can hold back any furry. Either they are new or just have a difficult time getting out of their shell. This panel will offer tips and advice on how to get out of your shyness comfortable shell. Hiding in the corner or watching others can be fun. But won’t getting involved bring more excitement? Come see what tips can help you.

entries.name: Mindfulness and Meditation
entries.description: Being present and mindful is at the heart of nearly every philosophical tradition and is at the core of bringing peace of mind to lives. This workshop will introduce the fundamentals of mindfulness and philosophical ontology, teach practices that are useful for centering ourselves and bringing possibility to everyday situations, discuss letting go of our barriers to create who we want to be, and includes a short mindfulness meditation.

entries.name: Magic: The Gathering - Cube Draft
entries.description:
Do you enjoy Magic: The Gathering but didn't bring your cards?  No problem!  Come for a cube draft where the cards are supplied for you!
Eight players maximum -- first come, first registered!  Event registration opens one hour before the event begins.
Prize support will be supplied.

entries.name: Fursuit Repair: Sew If You Dare
entries.description: If you want to learn how to repair and maintain fursuits, but have never used a sewing needle or hot glue gun before, then this panel is for you!  Learn the tools, techniques, and rizz it takes to have your current or future suits last for many years. This panel will be informative, interactive, and full of memes.  No experience is required.  Goodie bags will be provided for those who come early

entries.name: Chinese Language 101
entries.description: 大家好 (Dàjiā hǎo)! Want to learn a few words for yipping and yapping in Chinese with fellow furries? Curious about how to describe your fursona’s species, make animal sounds, or call your friends cute in Chinese? Join this panel and learn all about it! All levels welcome; no prior experience needed!

entries.name: Kemono meetup!
entries.description: A meetup for fans of the kemono style! There will be a group photo 30 minutes after start time.

entries.name: Harper's Swapmeet
entries.description:
Bring your fursuits, fursuit parts, props, plushies, fandom merch, and other goodies to trade with other furries!! Well have a table for any freebies you want to just put out there.

Please note, we do not allow the exchange of products via money. Trades ONLY.

entries.name: Dungeons and Dining
entries.description: Learn how to make tasty cost efficient meals with dragon host “Stale Rice”

If you are organizing a large group photo, please reserve a time on furcon.org/meetups.

entries.name: Transhumanism, Cybernetics, and Furry Ergonomics
entries.description: Do you want a real, functional tail? Or at least a robotic one? Dream of being more than human, err, less human? Relevant technologies, both biological and robotic, are progressing rapidly, with many not that far off. We will review some more developments in the heavily intertwined topics of AI, neuroscience, robotics, medicine, and more that are foundational to these ambitions. We will also have a light-hearted discussion of what challenges and opportunities might await a society of augmented humans and anthropomorphic creatures.

entries.name: Red Panda Union Meet
entries.description: Tired of all the business talk at the con? Wanna make your worker rights heard? Come join the Red Panda Union, we have bamboo, we perform forbidden rituals, and we offer insurance against Snow Leopards. Prepare for a nice photo shoot too!

entries.name: Coffee with Our Charity
entries.description: Join us for coffee and donuts while you get familiar with The Furcon Charity: The LGBTQ Youth Center

entries.name: The Art of Storytelling
entries.description: The ability to craft wonderful stories is one of our greatest gifts. Come and explore some of the finer points of storytelling expertise, including delves into the storytelling wisdoms of Zootopia, Watership Down, Totoro, and a pair that feature raccoons.

entries.name: First Aid for Fursuiters
entries.description: Have you ever wondered what to do when you see your friend in distress? Come chat with AshenPanda about how to recognize signs of an emergency and what you can do to help keep the fandom safe.

entries.name: Bay Battle Prelims
entries.description: Want to be in Bay Battle? Come audition! Note: Sign-ups are supposed to be done online; if you're just now getting to the con, go to the FC website to sign up.

entries.name: 25 years of Confusion
entries.description: Further Confusion's first year was in 1999, just over 25 years ago.  We'll look back on where the convention has come over the years, with staff from those early years to tell tales from those first few years of the convention.  If you were around in those years, feel free to join in on the reminiscing!

If you have any questions, please contact us directly at info@twistedtailsescape.com.

entries.name: The Art of the Con Badge
entries.description: Unique to the furry fandom, con badges are how we express ourselves and identify each other! Come learn how this art form began in the Long Long Ago, learn the basics on getting your own, and explore the many creative mediums people have used to craft their own!

entries.name: Bat meet and squeak
entries.description: Come and share your love of sky puppies! Bats and bat friends welcome to come and say haiiiiii - possibly at frequencies above what most furries can hear

entries.name: Furry Found Footage
entries.description: Furry Found Footage is a glutted amalgamation of ancient VHS tapes, featuring forgotten cartoons, unseen movies, and old furry con footage, all spliced together to make you laugh, cry, and appreciate the un-famous. Includes some (blur-censored) mature content.

location.name: Marriott: Marriott Stage (Salon I to VI)

entries.name: Fur The Grey - We Ain’t Old Yet!
entries.description: Joe Bear and ‘Mama Mel’ return for the seventh year hosting this insightful panel geared toward older furries. All of you kids get off the lawn - this is for Greymuzzles who want to look at the latest research in “successful aging.” Topics covered include “train your brain” and social strategies to get the best out of the second half of your life.

entries.name: Sticker Making and Trading Panel
entries.description: Love stickers? We do too! Come make and trade stickers! We’ll have some pre-printed designs, color markers and blank sheets for all levels of sticker makers! Bring your sticker collection to trade with other sticker heads!

entries.name: Blue fur meet and greet
entries.description: Blue fursuiters and blue furred characters meet and chat in the social event.

entries.name: University Furs Meetup
entries.description:
Furries? At my university? It's more likely than you think!

Do you go to university? Want to talk and connect with furries of similar majors? Or maybe you'd like to ask for advice for college or start a furry club at your school! If so, this is the panel for you!

entries.name: Bay Battle Dance-Off
entries.description: Returning for its 4th year, Bay Battle is back at FC! Dancers get a say in the first round songs, as fursuiters and non-suiters alike climb a tournament style bracket, to achieve ultimate victory on the dance floor!

entries.description: Come see the metalcore band, Break the Design, debut their first album live at Further Confusion 2025!

entries.name: DJ Meetup
entries.description: Meetup with fellow DJs, share stories and experiences, and ask FC's DJ Coordinator what it's all about!  Don't forget your USB!

entries.name: An Intro To Vore
entries.description: The corporate world can be pretty dog-eat-dog, and this panel aims to explain how to navigate that competitive environment! Pillowtummy breaks down the origins and reasons for why so many furs enjoy vore in this 18+ edutainment presentation.

entries.name: Furry Nerds
entries.description: Are you interested in Science, Technology, Engineering and/or Mathematics? Come join in to ask a panel of different furries across different STEM fields to answer your burning questions.

entries.name: Furs Do Film
entries.description: I play movie scenes, with loud audio.  Furs then emote them -- ideally in suit!  Imagine your favorite furs acting out Pulp Fiction, Fight Club, or Star Wars!

entries.name: Anti-Glomp; Self-Defense for Unwanted Touch
entries.description: A practical panel with self defense techniques against unwanted touch. From accidentally-too-excited hugs without consent, to overly aggressive grabbing, learn to remove yourself safely -- in or out of fursuit! Singles or groups welcome.

entries.name: Boof's N Goof's Meet
entries.description: Are you a boof. Are u a lil goof..y? Well then this meet is right for you! Boof's N Goof's will be a chance for big dog's like Saint Bernards, Bernese Mountain Dog's, Samoyed's, And so much more to get to know eachother and have a goofy time. Anyone is welcome and can even be an Honorary Boof!

entries.name: SCPs of the 90s
entries.description: Most people think that SCP began in 2007, turns out that the 90s had it too. Join Rascal and Clover by experiencing [or re-experiencing] the f%#cked up parts of a decade that are better off forgetting.

entries.name: Final Fantasy XIV Meetup
entries.description: Calling all adventurers from across Eorzea & beyond! Join us at the "Final Fantasy XIV Meetup" panel, a purr-fect gathering of Final Fantasy XIV fans who also happen to be part of the furry community. This panel offers a unique opportunity to celebrate the intersection of two vibrant worlds: the captivating realm of Eorzea and the diverse, creative world of furry fandom.

entries.name: Bird Meetup
entries.description: Feathered friends and friends of feathered friends, come along to meet fellow bird furries! Snacks will be provided.

entries.name: I Feel Weird: Strange Desires from the Golden Age of Animation
entries.description:
Join us for a screening of "those" cartoons - you know the ones. The Looney Tunes that stirred up uncanny desires you'd never felt before, and gave you uncomfortable feelings that didn’t have a name. A loveless lovebird wants desperately to be swallowed whole by a voracious puddy tat. A potion is consumed, and a tiny mouse begins expanding his horizons. There are wolves in sheep’s lingerie, bunnies beyond binaries, and bears under the thrall of mesmerizing emanations.  Do you remember the double-bind of Ferdie Fox’s resurrection? Do you remember when existential fear first felt warm? 

Tonight, the glow of the TV will be our full moon, as we unwind tight coils of 16mm film and VHS tape to unleash lost memories of transformative Saturday mornings. Your host Auryn will overshare stories from childhood while guiding you through the classic cartoons that launched a million kinks. This is where you came from, remember? 

After successfully corrupting America’s precious youth at FWA and MFF, this new presentation for FC features permanent audience hypnosis, new HD transfers of rare films, a delicious homage to Laurie Anderson, and 300% more personal vulnerability! 

So bring your sublimated desire and your PJs!

entries.description: Our friend suspects that their partner is having an affair. Join us as we find out the truth in a Jerry Springer inspired reality show!

entries.name: "Fabulous Beasts" of Chinese Mythology
entries.description: Are you a fan of 有兽焉 (YouShouYan) aka Fabulous Beasts? Would you like to see creatures of Chinese Mythology turned furry? Come see some amazing Chinese furry animated shows/manhua, meet other fans of the series, and perhaps learn something about the fascinating lore of mythological creatures! (Also giving away official merch of the shows)

entries.name: The Terrible, No-Good Game Show
entries.description: Are you ready for the worst, most scuffed game show of your life? Prepare for multiple games with twists, turns, and surprises. With enough perseverance, you can beat the unfair host at his own game and win! This game show is also 18+, and will feature adult content.

entries.name: DIY Your Own Silicone Toy!
entries.description: The 101 for making your own silicone fun.  This panel will cover the design and manufacturing of silicone toys for *personal use*.  From design, refinement, moldmaking, and casting, the fun of making toys is almost more than using them!

entries.name: Astrophotography In’s & Out’s: An amateur’s view!
entries.description: An overview and discussion of how to get involved with Astrophotography, from the simplest gear to the more complex. I’ll look at manual operation as well as automation. And what I’ve learned to expect and not to expect in the hobby.

entries.name: Sergal Merp-n-Derp
entries.description:
A social hangout and photo shoot for sergals and other vilous creatures! Similar cryptids are welcome too.

We will convene, socialize for a little while, and then run the usual gauntlet of photos.

entries.name: VRChat IRL Meetup
entries.description: IRL Friends+ World: Free-for-all meetup & mingle. Full body tracking and colliders enabled. Can we request a mirror for the room please?

entries.name: Dr Blimpyroo’s Very Serious Lecture
entries.description: Dr Blimpyroo and friends present a demonstration of their recent work in reality modification, which will *definitely not* result in toony chaos unfolding, such as: latex, PVC, inflation, flattening, berrification, and more! Warning: Audience members in the first row may get TFed...

entries.name: WHYoming (Stand up comedy)
entries.description: Wyoming is like the badlands of Texas with the majesticism of Siberia. A land with the least amount of laws and most amount of guns. What stories come from this strange land? Come laugh at the strangest luck Pony for Hire has to say about this place-

entries.name: Polyamory 201: Now What?
entries.description:
So you've opened your relationship, now what? 
Come join your fellow poly furs in an open discussion on how to build and maintain successful open relationships. 

this is an 18+ panel

entries.name: Casual Friday
entries.description:
Kinda long, but it's fun:

Fancy Friday? Nah, none of that this year. We're doing Business Casual Friday and blending in with upper management! Join us for after-dinner delights alongside the myriad of engaging discussion topics FC Inc. has to offer. Our pastries and caffeinated beverages are as exquisite as can be for our employees, and our fine selection of liquors is available at our cash bar with valid ID. We shall permit admittance only to our most esteemed colleagues — our stock-holders. Our lovely employees can procure evidence of their stock ownership by purchasing tickets online at http://reg.furcon.org in advance, or purchasing them at the door. To our employees of the month — our Super-Sponsors — your registration serves as testament to your dedication and comes with a ticket for the event. Don't miss this exclusive event!

entries.description:
What if Improv is about creating moments instead of presenting jokes in rapid fire? Step inside the dojo and learn how to use mindfulness- and presence-based techniques to create compelling theatre from nothing! Anyone is welcome to imagine.

Presented by The Fists of Improv, a local diverse AF improv troupe.

entries.name: Modern Jazz Lounge — Casual Friday
entries.description:
Patrick Talesfore, Jr. is a drum set artist from Sunnyvale, CA. his playing has been described as “...cognizant, deliberate, musical...like facing a life or death moment. Passion personified.” Patrick is most recognized for his work with Cerce, Space Devil Rest in Peace, and #FREEJAZZHOUSEPARTY. Patrick has made positive connections in the fandom through his music and it has been a dream of his to perform at Further Confusion. 

#FREEJAZZHOUSEPARTY, featuring Jackson Levin on trumpet and Jesús Ramos on synthesizers and electronics, plays an eclectic mix of music rooted in the jazz tradition with sets consisting of contemplative lo-fi, fiery free-jazz, ambient minimalism, and the avant-garde creating an atmospheric, soulful refuge for those willing to listen…

This performance is exclusive to Fancy Friday attendees. For more jazz funk, you can also catch us on Sunday night.

In this fun and fully illustrated talk, we’ll talk about building communities of care to better support one another and ourselves. Q&A at the end!

entries.description:

Then come participate in my gameshow! I'll laugh at you. Maybe you'll win cash money! 
It's not a lot, so don't expect too much, but it'll cover lunch if you win it, at least.

entries.name: Transgender Furs Meet & Greet
entries.description:
Curious about connecting with other transgender furries?

Join the Trans Furry Meet & Greet at Further Confusion! 

Non-Binary, questioning/curious, and cisgendered furs are welcome! ❤️

Bring friends and family – all allies are welcome!

Hope you're all ready to meet up with your fellow hunger-enthralled enthusiasts, because the vore meetup is back again! Serving up friends new and old and some memorable badges, you won't want to miss this event.

entries.name: Wings of Fire After Dark
entries.description: An 18+ only panel for Wings of Fire fans who love the adult side of the fandom. Expect to see a group reading of popular fan works, plenty of shipping, and lots of fun!

entries.name: Hacking and Networking Adult Toys
entries.description: Following the progression of other consumer devices, it's now entirely typical for adult toys to have USB charging, bluetooth-connected mobile apps, and cloud interfaces, many with APIs. But why suffer with the limited experience these companies offer and the numerous associated privacy concerns? This panel will cover some of the exciting recent developments in the homebrew and small-business kink community and showcase several specific devices as in-depth case studies. LIVE DEMOS ARE TENTATIVELY PLANNED!

entries.name: Furry Burners: Attending Burning Man
entries.description: Panel hosted by seasoned Burners who can share their experiences about visiting Burning Man for the first time, or for other seasoned burners who want to meet and greet and share their experiences as well! entries.name: Space Business!  The NewSpace Economy
entries.description: Lunar mining, capturing asteroids potentially worth billions or even trillions, and casual space tourism - all previously distant fantasies, but now major business aspirations! On top of all this, a new space race is brewing, infusing nationalist passion and significant funding from governments. Let's talk about this world of "New Space" ventures, recent ups and downs in the market, and where this may all be headed.

entries.name: Puppy Play Panel & Social
entries.description: Do you identify closely with real puppies, kitties, or ponies? Do you envy how puppies live for the moment & let go of all inhibitions with a head pat, kind word, or treat!? Come learn about what pup play is, what you do and don't need, and how much fun you can have. After the panel, you can join in on the fun as we host a mosh! If you've never been to a mosh, picture a dog park but full of human puppies, and maybe a few kitties, too! Hosted by BAY-PAH! For more information about BAY-PAH: https://bay-pah.com!

entries.name: Ham Radio Exam
entries.description:
Come score your amateur radio license from the comfort of the con! Be sure to bring:

1. A legal photo ID or two forms of identification (non-photo ID, birth certificate, library card, social security card, current student ID, and/or postmarked utility bill).
2. An FCC Federal Registration Number (FRN). Obtain one by registering at https://apps.fcc.gov/cores
3. If upgrading, a photocopy of your current license, or the originals and photocopies of any Certificates of Successful Completion of Examination (CSCE) from previous exam sessions if credit is required.
4. A calculator with memory erased and formulas cleared is allowed. Cell phones must be silenced or turned off during the exam session and the phones' calculator function may not be used.
5. A check, money order, or cash to cover the $15 exam fee.

entries.description: Ever wondered how your favorite animated films got made? Want to know what it takes to get a job making drawings come alive? Then join this panel where we'll cover the production pipeline for all types of animation, from "All Dogs Go To Heaven" to "Zootopia+" and explore career paths in the animation industry.

entries.name: Furries in Indie Comics
entries.description:
Join indie comic artist Lonnie Garcia, author of Putty Pygmalion, and radical indie cartoonists Iggy Craig, author of Sad Girl Space Lizard and Ice Cream and Beast, and Eddy Atoms, author of Pinky and Pepper Forever and Making Comic Zines, to talk about their experiences in making, pitching, and publishing comics with indie presses, particularly the San Francisco indie publisher Silver Sprocket Press. We will cover DIY publishing, networking, and how to present yourself to publishers while also being true to yourself and your artistic practice. 
Panel will end with a Q&A and a book signing with the cartoonists.

entries.name: Hackin Your Relationships Part Two: More than 10₂
entries.description:
Steve (Tanuski) and Junaos
Join us for an enlightening and lively talk by Junaos & Tanuski (Steve) as they dive into the world of non-monogamy, attachment theory, and becoming your best self in a polyamorous relationship! Discover the intricacies of maintaining multiple loving relationships, understand your attachment style, and learn practical tips on fostering healthy connections. Whether you're poly-curious or a seasoned polyamorous pro, this talk promises to offer valuable insights and a fun, engaging experience. Don't miss out on this chance to grow and thrive in your relationships!

entries.name: What the Perkele is a Moomin?
entries.description: Moomintroll and his little world, created by Finnish/Swedish artist Tove Jansson, has been delighting audiences all over the world since the 1940s, and recently has been growing in popularity in the furry community. This panel is for fans new and old, and anybody else who is interested in learning more about the whimsical and sometimes poignant world of Moominvalley. Your host, a longtime Moomin fan themself, takes you on a journey through the real-life history, the characters, the life of the authoress, and various media adaptations of Tove Jansson’s most popular work.

entries.description: A showing of the Lackadaisy Pilot and several shorts, behind the scenes footage, and a question and answer section featuring series creator Tracy Butler, showrunner Fable Siegel, plus additional cast and crew.

entries.description: Come hang out with inflatables and the people who collect them. Come show off your favorite toy or find out where to get your own. Panel is all ages but we request minors have a guardian with them at all times.

entries.name: Return to Kooky Trails
entries.description: The cast and crew of Kooky Trails are back! Be the first to see the new short film, "Kooky Trails Prologue", and then join us for a kooky Q&A, hosted by our "virtual moderator" special guest broadcasted live via the Kooky Trails!

entries.name: Magic: The Gathering - Oathbreaker
entries.description:
Let's get together for two rounds of Oathbreaker!
Players will compete in four pods of four with the winner of each pod competing for the top spot!
Don't have an Oathbreaker deck?  We'll have a few available that you can borrow.
16 players max.  First come, first registered.  Registration opens one hour before the event begins.
Prize support will be supplied.

entries.name: VR Portal
entries.description: See your friends in VR! Located in the Santa Clara foyer of the Hilton.

entries.name: Hacking Through the Ages: Internet Safety and Hygiene (Presented by DEFCON Furs)
entries.description: Since the birth of the internet in 1983, bad actors have been honing techniques to deceive you, steal from you, and harvest your data. Join a panel of infosec practitioners as they explore the evolution of the internet and hacking, share some common sense techniques that can keep you safe as you surf the web, and introduce you to the furry enclave within the world's largest information security conference.

entries.name: Ask A Marine Biologist
entries.description: Have any burning questions you'd like to ask to a marine biologist? A masters student is here to try to answer them all. What's really going on under the sea? Why are sea otters the nastiest little gremlins ever? Are sharks better than dolphins? The state is stealing my sand?!

If you are organizing a large group photo, please reserve a time on furcon.org/meetups.

entries.name: Ten Furward: Live Long and Pawsper!
entries.description: Do you partake in endless discussions about the best series, movie, captain? Philosophical debates about post-scarcity queer space utopia over root beer? Perhaps your fursona is a Caitian, Gorn, Aurelian? Or all that sounds like Klingon but you're intrigued? Everyone's welcome to beam up to this all-Trek meetup!

entries.description: Join us for an interactive D&D panel where volunteers from the audience become heroes and villains. The performance is fursuit friendly and we'll have a giant plush D20 for you to roll!

entries.description: Drop in and visit bunnies! They will be available for photos, drawing, pets, and general adoration.

entries.name: Furry Figure Drawing for Fun!
entries.description: Come learn how to draw from life with an emphasis on storytelling and character! We’ll start with a short lecture on the approach we’ll be working with and then do some life drawing together. All experience levels are welcome, and please bring your own materials!

entries.name: Wild High (Upcoming Furry Cartoon)
entries.description: Watch a 5 minute sneak peek of a new indie cartoon being released to YouTube next year, as well as meet some of the talented folks working on the project!

entries.name: Ask A Greymuzzle Anything
entries.description: We've been at this Furry Thing for a while -- seen its ups and downs, seen the good attention and the bad, and seen some of the Old Guard start to pass away. Where did all this come from, and where might it be going? Feel free to ask someone who's been there through much of it all.

entries.name: Furry Ham Radio and Technology Get-together
entries.description: A large number of furries are also into amateur radio. Ham radio has evolved significantly in the last few years through digital modes and has seen a resurgence of traditional high frequency communications. Come gather with other furry hams and perspective hams to discuss radios, projects, and what ever technological topics we find funny and interesting.

entries.name: FC: Unleashed Dress Rehearsal
entries.description: Dress Rehearsal for all FC: Unleashed participants.

entries.name: Zero to Cidery with Slightly Furry
entries.description: Come hear the story of the world's first licensed furry alcohol producers in Seattle, Washington. We'll cover how we started and now run Slightly Furry along with the basics of cider and beer making for you to try your paw at it too someday. Got questions about alcohol production? We'll try our best for answers.

entries.name: FUR-CAL: San Diego Fur Con
entries.description: Are you interested in meeting the board of directors for FUR-CAL the group behind San Diego Fur Con? Stop in while we host a public board meeting, where you can ask questions, get answers, and learn about the future of the next furry convention to take place in Southern California!

entries.name: Furry Visual Novels Panel
entries.description: Are you only moving in circles after finishing Echo? Still upset Torahiko never got an official route in Morenatsu? Then head on over to discuss your favorite furry visual novels! You may find a new favorite! Adults only please!

entries.name: Whiskers & Wit: Improv Games For All!
entries.description: Have you ever wanted to be a part of an improv show, but never knew where to start? This is the place for you! Here, you can learn the basics of improv, and even play some games if you’re up for it, all family friendly! Fursuits encouraged, not required!

entries.name: Furry Studies: A Conversation
entries.description: After the convergence of furry scholars at Furry Studies 2024: "Being Furry," hosted by Otterdam Furry Arts Festival, participants will reconvene to discuss their own experience with the conference and its impact on current and future studies on furry.

entries.name: Modern Jazz Lounge
entries.description:
Patrick Talesfore, Jr. is a drum set artist from Sunnyvale, CA. his playing has been described as “...cognizant, deliberate, musical...like facing a life or death moment. Passion personified.” Patrick is most recognized for his work with Cerce, Space Devil Rest in Peace, and #FREEJAZZHOUSEPARTY. Patrick has made positive connections in the fandom through his music and it has been a dream of his to perform at Further Confusion. 

#FREEJAZZHOUSEPARTY, featuring Jackson Levin on trumpet and Jesús Ramos on synthesizers and electronics, plays an eclectic mix of music rooted in the jazz tradition with sets consisting of contemplative lo-fi, fiery free-jazz, ambient minimalism, and the avant-garde creating an atmospheric, soulful refuge for those willing to listen…

There's something here for everyone! Either to waste time between events or as a place to chill, we will be here. Bags will be checked at the door. Learn more: http://furcon.org/programming/gaming/

entries.description:
Yarrrrrrr! Reckon ye’ve got what it takes to discover the Secret of the Furbidden Treasure? Or perhaps you want to help Captain Cody Escape from Otter Space! 

Tickets are $25 per person with a maximum of 10 players per group. Players by themselves or in a small group will be paired up with other like-minded adventurers to a maximum of 10 players per game. For private bookings, a minimum of 5 tickets must be purchased. Also, a portion of every ticket will go to the convention's charity! If you have any questions, please contact us directly at info@twistedtailsescape.com.

entries.name: Practicing Mindfulness and Taking Care of Ourselves
entries.description: There are moments at a con where things are stressful and times after the con where PCD(Post Con Depression) kicks in hard. I want to shed light on how we can take care of ourselves mentally at a con and how to take care of ourselves mentally after a con. I wand this to be a space were we can share some of our experiences and tips to help those who just need some tools to help them be mindful of themselves and to take care of themselves. This will be a space for all to find a moment of calm among the sea of stress and anxiety.

entries.name: Fursuit Lounge
entries.description: Need a place to cool off? Come on in and hang up your head! We have water and fans available for you, so you can fursuit safely.

entries.name: Coffee (for Closers!)
entries.description: Toss your office Keurig out a window, you deserve better! :) Latte will demonstrate a variety of pour-over coffee methods and gadgets, and break down the brewing process step by step.

entries.name: Furry Financial Fluency
entries.description: Let's face it, this fandom is a lot of fun, but can also be expensive! Which makes knowing how to manager your money essential for participating stress-free! In this panel, we'll go over all the basics of personal finances and how to manage your money both in and out of the furry fandom. From questions like "should I put a fursuit on a credit card?" to "what's the difference between a checking and a savings account", we'll layout all the groundwork needed for you to start being fluent the language of money!

entries.name: International Snack Exchange
entries.description: Got some cool snacks from your home country? Have tasty things left over from a room party? Come and share them Monday afternoon! Make a new friend over noms.

entries.name: Being Furry in Second life
entries.description: Over recent years there have been quite a few panels around being furry in VR chat. However many people seem to forget there is a second, even older virtual platform furries have been hanging out in for decades. So if you've been around Second Life for a long time or are curious to hear what it's really all about stop by and let’s talk about it.

entries.name: Hiss and Purr
entries.description:
Had a great time? Wish some things could have been different? Come let us know what you think! A panel of FurCon executives will be here to listen and are ready for your suggestions.

Your feedback is greatly appreciated and can help make a difference! If you can't make it to this session, please email us at feedback@furtherconfusion.org

location.name: Marriott: Marriott Stage (Salon I to VI)

entries.name: Furry Retrocomputing Show!
entries.description: Fan of chiptunes, pixel art, and everything 8-bit? You may not realize these old boring business machines and feeble home computers hold important places in the history of the fandom, and are foundational to its early art and online communities. Come watch a slice of all this through the Demoscene, an instantly recognized but rarely noticed subculture dedicated to producing live multimedia computer art, all rendered in realtime. Witness a live showing on an array of computers new and old, from Ataris and Amigas to modern PCs, while learning about the evolution of the Demoscene and some broader computing history.
